title: Police Report

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a police report for January 18, 2025 at the Jiminy Peak Mountain Resort.  Our client Ilene Robinson was the injured party.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Attorney John J. O'Neill, Jr.

title: Executive Order 14188 ("Additional Measures to Combat Anti-Semitism") 60-Day Report (Education)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the report required by Executive Order 14188 at §3(a). Executive Order 14188 is available at https://www.whitehouse.gov/presidential-actions/2025/01/additional-measures-to-combat-anti-semitism. Executive Order 14188 requires a report by each agency concerning "authorities or actions" that "might be used to curb or combat anti-Semitism."
I request that this request be expedited under 34 CFR § 5.21(i)(2)(i)(B) for the following reasons:

1. I certify the following to be true and correct: My organization is primarily engaged in disseminating information. The Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression (FIRE) maintains a news website at https://thefire.org/news, through which its staff members regularly publish news stories and editorial content concerning the activities of governments, government officials, and other persons or organizations of public concern. I am a staff member of FIRE. I frequently write about matters involving the First Amendment and academic freedom, including on FIRE's website. See, e.g., https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303. A substantial component of my duties as a staff member of FIRE is to obtain information through public records requests, including through the Freedom of Information Act, which I or my colleagues then share through FIRE's website and social media channels. I also publish news and other information of public concern via "X" (https://x.com/adamsteinbaugh) and "Bluesky" (https://bsky.app/profile/adamsteinbaugh.bsky.social).

2. The requested information concerns an actual or alleged government activity, namely the Department's response to an Executive Order concerning activity or expression that may be protected by the First Amendment.

3. The requested information extends beyond the public's right to know about government activity generally and instead has a particular value that would be lost if not processed on an expedited basis. The information pertains to a news story of public interest. That issue has attracted a wide range of news media coverage, including the numerous articles identified below, which are helpful in establishing that there is an urgency to inform the public on this topic.

In addition to the significant range of news coverage relating to the Trump administration's response to anti-semitism, particularly as it relates to higher education, examples of recent articles demonstrating the public's ongoing and current interest in this information include these articles:

https://www.algemeiner.com/2025/01/30/this-failure-ends-today-trump-issues-major-executive-order-campus-antisemitism/
https://www.wsj.com/opinion/mr-trump-investigate-my-campus-hamas-rape-denial-hostile-environment-for-jews-and-women-politics-77dec881
https://www.commentary.org/seth-mandel/trumps-new-executive-order-on-anti-semitism/
https://reason.com/volokh/2025/02/03/may-aliens-be-deported-based-on-their-speech/
https://www.newsmax.com/newsmax-tv/alan-dershowitz-donald-trump-antisemitism/2025/01/29/id/1197083/
https://www.newsmax.com/newsmax-tv/mike-huckabee-donald-trump-antisemitism/2025/01/29/id/1197085/
https://legalinsurrection.com/2025/01/trump-signs-executive-orders-dealing-with-antisemitism-critical-race-theory-in-education/
https://www.campusreform.org/article/roundup-trump-issues-executive-orders-deport-hamas-lovers-protect-school-choice-fight-back-dei-/27390
https://www.dailyuw.com/news/trump-executive-order-directs-universities-to-monitor-for-and-report-activities-of-foreign-students/article_958cc45e-e0cf-11ef-8072-0731e3bb9e5e.html
https://www.purdueexponent.org/opinion/editorials/palestine-editorial-exponent-protest/article_fa7a8626-e025-11ef-bf4b-d7af2a263c11.html
https://www.columbiaspectator.com/news/2025/01/30/trump-issues-executive-order-to-combat-campus-anti-semitism-report-activities-by-alien-students
https://dailynorthwestern.com/2025/02/10/opinion/bernstein-as-a-jewish-student-the-executive-order-on-antisemitism-doesnt-speak-for-me

REQUEST FOR A FEE WAIVER OR REDUCED FEES:

I request, under 34 CFR § 5.21(b), a waiver or reduction of fees for the following reasons:

1. Disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because its disclosure would shed light on the operations or activities of the government. The requested information pertains specifically to the Department's response to protests on college campuses. The Department has made a concerted effort to draw public attention to its activities in this regard.

2. Disclosure of the requested information would be likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of those operations or activities. Disclosure of the requested information would meaningfully inform the public about the Department's activities and operations.

3. Disclosure of the requested information will contribute to the understanding of a reasonably broad audience of persons interested in the subject, as opposed to the individual understanding of the requester. The requestor is a licensed attorney who practices First Amendment law. As such, the requestor will be able to effectively convey information to the public. Further, the requestor is a representative of the news media. The requestor and his employer, the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression, gather information of potential interest to a segment of the public, turns that information into distinct works (including through its news website, located at https://thefire.org/news), and distributes that information to the public. The information requested here relates to information that is about current events or that would be of current interest to the public. The requestor's past publication record (in addition to FIRE's articles available at https://thefire.org/news) is available at https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303.

4. The requested information is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester. The requestor works for a nonprofit organization and the records are not sought for a commercial purpose.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Public Information Act Request – Department Manual and Officer Gregory Ceraso Disciplinary History

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Public Information Act Request – Department Manual and Officer Gregory Ceraso Disciplinary History
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Records Custodian,

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, Chapter 552 of the Texas Government Code, I respectfully request access to a copy of the Dallas Police Department’s full and current policy and procedures manual. This includes, but is not limited to:

General Orders

Department Handbook

Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs)

Rules and Regulations Manual

Any written directives, protocols, or administrative manuals governing:

Officer conduct

Traffic enforcement procedures

Use of force

Body-worn camera policy

Complaint intake and internal investigations

Search and seizure

Arrest protocols

Vehicle stops and detentions

Personnel accountability

Any other department-wide operational guidance

In addition, I request access to all internal and external complaints, disciplinary actions, and investigative findings involving Officer Gregory Ceraso from the start of his employment with the Dallas Police Department to the end of his tenure there. This includes:

Citizen complaints (sustained, not sustained, unfounded, or exonerated)

Internal affairs investigations

Records of suspension, demotion, written reprimands, or terminations

Use-of-force reviews or reports

Any civil rights or misconduct claims involving Officer Ceraso

If any portion of the requested records is considered exempt, I request that you provide all non-exempt portions and include a written explanation referencing the applicable exemption(s) under Texas Government Code § 552.301.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Wayne

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Brady List (March 2025) (Wahkiakum County Prosecuting Attorney)
communications.communication:
Hi, there’s been no change in status since last year: no responsive records. Not necessarily because we’re so virtuous, but because Brady-worthy officers are rare and Wahkiakum County is very small.

We do have a state highway that state troopers patrols, but when I see a new trooper’s name on a ticket, I consult the WSP Brady list, which I assume you have already requested directly from them. Since I neither have nor maintain that list, I’m assuming that you are not requesting it from me. Last couple of times we (i.e. muckrock.com and me) did this, you were OK with that, and I hope you still are!

New Washington State case law requires me to say the following things:


  *   I believe you have received all the information called for in your request, which is none because I don’t have any responsive records.
  *   I believe this request is closed.
  *   Because the request is closed, the statute of limitations on any public records lawsuit begins to run today.
  *   If you do not believe this request is fully satisfied, if you think there’s been a misunderstanding between us about what you were asking for, if there’s any reason you can think of why this request should stay open, please notify me within a reasonable time – say, two weeks?

Thanks for putting up with the disclaimers. Have a great day!

title: Public Records Request – Portland Parks Considered for Closure

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maine Freedom of Access Act, I hereby request the following records:

To: Portland Parks, Recreation & Facilities Department
From: David Lide, Publisher, Maine Times
📧 david.lide@mainetimes.com
📰 news@mainetimes.com
📞 1-800-488-1820

Dear Records Officer,

Under the Maine Freedom of Access Act (1 M.R.S. § 401 et seq.), I respectfully submit this request on behalf of Maine Times, a privately held statewide news outlet focused on in-depth public-interest reporting and community accountability.

As part of an editorial series exploring access to public space and municipal infrastructure, Maine Times is requesting information about any Portland city parks or recreational facilities currently under internal review for closure, sale, or long-term service reductions.

Records Requested:
Please provide any lists, internal reports, memos, or summaries generated between January 1, 2022 and present that identify:

Parks or recreational facilities being considered for:

Closure, sale, repurposing, or permanent restricted access

Operational changes due to budget shortfalls, maintenance issues, or underutilization

If a formal list does not exist, we welcome any documentation reflecting internal discussions or evaluations.

About Maine Times
Maine Times is a privately owned statewide news organization, built with the long-term goal of becoming Maine’s leading source for credible journalism. While our flagship website is currently in development, Maine Times is actively producing original reporting through the Maine Times podcast and additional editorial channels.

We are building with purpose: to inform the public, amplify community voices, and hold institutions to account—across the entire state of Maine.

We respectfully request digital delivery of the requested records. If this request would result in any fees, please notify us in advance.

Thank you for your time and service.

Sincerely,
David Lide
Publisher – Maine Times
📧 david.lide@mainetimes.com
📰 news@mainetimes.com
📞 1-800-488-1820
🌐 Mainetimes.com

Have a story tip, know someone who should be featured, or interested in advertising? Reach out.
Maine Times is a privately held company based in Dover, Delaware, and proudly serves readers across the state.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by 1 M.R.S.A. § 408(6). The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David Lide

title: DOGE Access to Treasury Systems and IRS Communications (Department of Treasury)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: DOGE Access to Treasury Systems and IRS Communications (Department of Treasury)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All internal communications, emails, memorandums, or policy documents from January 1, 2024 to present that reference:
1. The Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE)
Elon Musk, in his role as leader of DOGE
2. The extent or nature of DOGE’s access to Treasury systems, including but not limited to the Internal Revenue Service (IRS), the Bureau of the Fiscal Service, or any Treasury-managed financial systems
5. Any written agreements, memorandums of understanding (MOUs), access authorization forms, or audit trails/logs showing the scope, level, or duration of access granted to DOGE personnel or contractors.

title: University of North Texas drag ban (University Of North Texas System)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: University of North Texas drag ban (University Of North Texas System)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any communications received, sent, or created by or for Chancellor Michael Williams, President Harrison Keller, Regent Laura Wright, Steve Moore, or any person employed by the University of North Texas System Office of Government Relations, on or after January 20, 2025, which either:

(a) concerns drag performances, including the GLAD Queer Alliance UNT Drag Show 2025 scheduled for April 10 and the UNT Gammas Drag Night with the Gammas scheduled for April 11; or 

(b) contains any of the following terms: "Executive Order", "gender ideology", "Queer Empowerment", "drag show", "drag shows", "drag performance", "drag performances", "drag night", "queer alliance", "YDSA", or "Young Democrats"; 

2. Any Title IX (or similar) complaint or report referencing the word "in drag", "drag performance", "drag show", "drag shows", or "drag performances". This request is limited to complaints filed on or after January 1, 2020.

3. Any records held by administrators or staff of the University of North Texas concerning the planning, logistics, or approval of (a) the GLAD Queer Alliance UNT Drag Show 2025 scheduled for April 10; or (b) the UNT Gammas Drag Night with the Gammas scheduled for April 11.

4. If the University of North Texas maintains a reservation system or database for event reservations, all entries (and records contained in the system) concerning (a) the GLAD Queer Alliance UNT Drag Show 2025 scheduled for April 10; or (b) the UNT Gammas Drag Night with the Gammas scheduled for April 11.

"Communications" means and includes emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, or any other form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: DOGE–CFPB Communications Regarding Agency Restructuring and Enforcement (Jan–Present)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: DOGE–CFPB Communications Regarding Agency Restructuring and Enforcement (Jan–Present)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Under the Freedom of Information Act, I request access to all communications (including emails, memos, or written directives) from January 1, 2025 to present between any representative of the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) and CFPB leadership (including the Acting Director and Chief Operating Officer). Please note that a federal judge has ruled DOGE is subject to FOIA (CREW v. DOGE, March 10, 2025), and has ordered expedited processing and full document preservation. This request falls squarely within the scope of that ruling.

Please include any documents that discuss:

Agency restructuring

Staff reductions, layoffs, or reassignments

Budget changes

Suspension or freezing of enforcement activities

I am a private citizen requesting this information for personal, non-commercial use.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andy Dufresne

title: Public Records Request – Dashcam and Bodycam Footage – July 19, 2023 Arrest of Dylan Lemma

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request – Dashcam and Bodycam Footage – July 19, 2023 Arrest of Dylan Lemma
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request access to the following public records related to the July 19, 2023 incident and arrest of Dylan Lemma, the 19-year-old son of Sheriff Dennis Lemma:

Dash camera footage from the deputy who attempted the traffic stop around 8:00 a.m. near East Lake Drive and Celestial Way, involving a Ford Mustang and a white Nissan, both allegedly racing.

Any available body-worn camera footage from deputies involved in the attempted stop, identification, or follow-up investigation.

According to public reports and agency statements, Dylan Lemma fled at high speed in a Ford Mustang after a Seminole County deputy attempted a traffic stop, and later turned himself in to the John E. Polk Correctional Facility on charges of fleeing and reckless driving. The incident has drawn public interest due to the relationship between the suspect and the head of the agency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to public records related to the January 15, 2025 arrest of Southwest Airlines pilot David Allsop, age 52, at Savannah/Hilton Head International Airport, including:

All body-worn camera footage from officers involved in the investigation, detainment, and arrest of Mr. Allsop on DUI charges at the airport, beginning from initial contact near or before 7:00 a.m.

Surveillance or security footage from the airport (if available and not exempt), particularly any camera angles showing the pilot’s interaction with security, gate agents, or passengers.

title: Right-to-Know Request – Bodycam and Dashcam Footage – July 11, 2023 Arrest of Lisa Marie Kroeger-Kangas

communications.subject: New Hampshire Right to Know Law Request: Right-to-Know Request – Bodycam and Dashcam Footage – July 11, 2023 Arrest of Lisa Marie Kroeger-Kangas
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Hampshire Right to Know Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to the following records related to the arrest of Lisa Marie Kroeger-Kangas, age 46, of Claremont, on or about Tuesday, July 11, 2023, by the New Hampshire State Police:

All body-worn camera footage from troopers involved in the traffic stop, arrest, and subsequent events on Interstate 93 northbound in Concord, beginning at approximately 11:30 p.m.

All dash camera footage from the State Police cruiser(s) involved in the stop and transport.

Any footage capturing the moment when Ms. Kroeger-Kangas allegedly kicked out the rear passenger-side window of a cruiser while detained, sending glass toward two troopers on scene. Any rear-seat footage of the suspect being transported.

According to public statements, Ms. Kroeger-Kangas was arrested for aggravated DUI, and additional charges—including resisting arrest, disorderly conduct, reckless operation, and criminal mischief—were added after the cruiser window was damaged.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Black (African) Book Publishers, Distributors, Stores, Authors and/or Titles

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Black (African) Book Publishers, Distributors, Stores, Authors and/or Titles
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

In October 1968, J. Edgar Hoover and the FBI (All Field Offices) launched a COINTELPRO Operation against black independent bookstores (booksellers), associations, distributors, publishers, authors, titles, etc. It was modeled after similar operations since the 1920s against independent, radical, leftist, socialist, communist, and other bookstores (booksellers), associations, distributors, publishers, authors, titles, etc.

Each FBI Office and Sub-Office was required to (1) identify bookstores in their territory, and (2) open investigations on each to determine if it was extremist in nature,” (3) the identities of the owners; (4) whether it is a front for any group or foreign interest; (5) whether individuals affiliated with the store engage in extremist activities; (5) the number, type, and source of books and material on sale; (5) the store’s financial condition; (6) its clientele; and (7) whether it is used as a headquarters or meeting place.”

We are especially interested about books by and about Kwame Nkrumah and Panaf Books (Press), Sekou Toure, Malcolm X, Marcus Garvey, Mao Tse Tung

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

ROBERT BROWN
